Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Bowl
Description: Black and red hemispherical bowl with an unrestricted mouth, simple lip and rounded base. The inside, which is black, has been burnished horizontally, leaving horizontal marks. The outside, which was more carefully burnished, bears a pinkish slip upon which a red design was made. The pattern covers most of the surface between the black border and the undecorated bottom. It consists of two horizontal bands of diagonal lines.
